website_summaries.verdict: An easy to hang screen with magnetic closing that's easy to use.
pros: Animals and children can push easily through this screen and it will close behind them
cons: If you try to use this screen with a metal door, you may find it sticking to the door instead of closing properly

customer_reviews.title: Not so much - NEW UPDATE!
customer_reviews.text: Meh - great idea. So-so execution. Dog ripped seam in a few days. Maybe try a better brand. UPDATE: I was so delighted to be contacted by the seller - unprompted. They contacted me and were determined to make me happy either through refund or replacement. After some friendly discussion, i became clear that my original purchase plus my dogs (6) there might have been of a minor defect plus heavy use with the dogs that led to some detachment fro the screen/magnet.. The seller went way above and beyond to make me happy. I go the new replacement in 2 days and it works perfectly! This is the kind of Sellers Amazon needs. Highly recommend product and Seller!
customer_reviews.author: Necky McStifferson

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Works well and our cat enjoys coming in and out of it. I had the whole thing up in 5-7 minutes.I suggest reinforcing it with pushpins or a staple gun. We used additional double sided tape, but it was no match for our recent heat wave and after a month or so melted off. It's been sturdy every since we added the pushpins. Also, the other reviews complain about the magnets not sticking together. Just remember to mount the middle (where the doors meet) slightly higher than the corners (an inch or two) and the magnets will close just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the one from iGotTech my first time around because of the 2000+ positive reviews and I neglected to measure my door frame before purchasing even though all sellers warn you to do so prior to purchase in all caps. Buy this one its half the price and the only difference is that the one from iGotTech costs twice as much and this one has weights sewn into the base to prevent the wind from blowing it open. Same packaging and everything they are probably even made by the same manufacturer. Don't let 2000+ five star reviews fool you, with this seller you get the same thing and pay half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WE've enjoyed this screen door
customer_reviews.text: WE've enjoyed this screen door, but within less than a year, it has a small tear in it. We're always careful now to rip it, and so we have no idea how this happened. Although the price is reasonable, I just can't see spending $20 every year on a replacement. **Update: We received a replacement screen door. Customer service has been very good compared to other vendors.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Fogus

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome! It’s a little big for my door I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! It’s a little big for my door I needed it for but I made it work. My dog is enjoying being able to go out and come back in from the yard as he pleases. I figured out it works best if you have some slack so the flaps can swing back and close. Because of this I did have to move the Velcro around a few times. Even with moving it it’s still holding great. I highly recommend this screen!
customer_reviews.author: Noflu

customer_reviews.title: Should I buy this product
customer_reviews.text: The product is very easy to install even if you mess up keep calm and figure it out. All you really need is a pair of scissors to install this and maybe a short stool and maybe a tape measure. I made a video of myself installing two of these and had self inflicted issue lol but revealed how I sorted it out. Very happy to use this product most days when the humidity is down or the breeze is high and it does very well keeping out the mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: I liked the first one so much that I bought a second one for a double door.
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. I bought the durable fibreglass version. Well, I know it's not the normal fabric. The Velcro and the thumbtack like nails when used provide a durable attachment and prevents bugs from crawling in the sides. Don't rush installing it. From the top, begin from the middle to a side. Then make put up the other side to the top checking to be sure the magnets will fall in place from top to bottom. Now begin attaching the sides from the top down, do not pull the screen to tight you want a slightly loose screen so that the magnets will easily attach to each other after you pass through. I would buy the brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Evans

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. Would return, but don't want to go through the hassle. Flaps won't stay closed. Definitely a cheaply made product. Will order from a different company next time I buy one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the product pictured
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought this screen before and it was great. It looked exactly like the photos. I bought it again for another door in my house and was sent an extremely cheap screen with chunky plastic magnet closures that left huge gaps open in the screen. Kind of defeats the purpose. The adhesive Velcro was also extremely cheap the second time around. When I checked the product picture there weren’t any photos of the product I received. Super confused.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Pilcher

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of the sizing!!
customer_reviews.text: The sizing on your products are as clear as mud!! I measured my door, the edge where I have my Velcro strip is 36" wide, and my door length is 82". This is what I purchased, not realizing that your 36"x82 also covers up to 38"x 88". So how am I supposed to use it, if it's an inch too wide and way too long that it drags on the ground? Frustrating to try to figure out what to order and then it doesn't fit. The product itself looks good and well made. But buyer beware on sizing!
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Better then ever
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased LIKE products that just don't last, they are not good if you have pets. Upon seeing Homitt Magnetic Screen Heavy Duty screen I like the look and sturdiness of the product. Well it's been over 2 months and it is doing a great job, the dogs have not damaged the screen and it does wonders in letting cool are in and keeping bugs out. Loved it and purchased a second one !!!
customer_reviews.author: George Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Works great and would totally recommend.
customer_reviews.text: We have had our screen up for a couple months now and it's working great! We installed on our interior garage door so that when the garage door is open we can keep the flies out of the house. It installed very easily (but full disclosure...we did not use the velcro and instead just staple gunned it to the wall...long story, but it made sense) and stays closed...even when it's windy, and it gets VERY windy where we live. We had a lesser quality screen similar to this one up last summer, but it did not have the heavier edging that this one does, so I'm thinking this one will last us several summers. I'd totally recommend this screen. :)
customer_reviews.author: L. Chollar

customer_reviews.title: Cheap looking, didn't fit door
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this product again. It didn't fit our door even though the size I bought said it would fit my door dimensions. It look cheap and ghetto on our back door. Not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha N.

customer_reviews.title: NOT worth it! Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, didn’t even last 2 weeks. Simple instructions however it was printed with poor English grammar, take from that what you will. The flap seemed like a good idea, but it was not executed very well. The Velcro allowed for some room to make the screen fit my door (my door is bigger) but the sticky tape is both a plus and a setback. It stuck so well, that when it started to peel off my door on its own it also peeled off the door paint!
customer_reviews.author: alyssa w

customer_reviews.title: bottom edge...
customer_reviews.text: .... is most important. Do NOT hang screen below bottom edge. If you do bottom wont want to unsnap easy and when it does it will get stuck on threshold. My dog can go out easy when hang below but can not come in. Shortening the length and using the pushpins doesnt hold the center and if pin comes out center will droop down and not seal. good luck.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Self CLOSING!!
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing an old one and this one is much better. Looks and feels very durable. It also closes easily on its own. The only thing I had a hard time with (and this does not reflect on the product) was the tacks. Hard to push in but a hammer ended up working fine
customer_reviews.author: Tamra

customer_reviews.title: I love it! My old screen door which cost many ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! My old screen door which cost many times this product was getting a bit ragged. I need one that my 30 lb dog can exit/enter on her own and this is perfect. Very easy to install, looks better than a regular screen since it has nice ribbing. This makes it more visible and has a look of quality. The weighting and magnets work perfectly. you (or your pet) walk through and it closes on it's own perfectly every time. I am not a paid reviewer...I just really like this product and will buy several more as replacements in the years to come, as I expect nothing to last forever. This is well worth the (very low) price.
customer_reviews.author: Skaliwag

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best purchase I’ve made in a long time! Paid for itself the very night it was installed by keeping out mosquito hawks and a wasp. The magnets are great, and it only needs a little help swinging shut every now and then. The only thing I wish was better: durability. We have dogs (I know, we can’t have nice things for this very reason) and the moment this was stepped on, it ripped a small hole in the net. We will be repairing and modifying the bottom with electrical tape, I think, to help the durability (and weight). All in all, highly recommend. Not super cheaply built, and will keep those bugs on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Average.
customer_reviews.text: I order a new one of these every spring because they don't last long. While this brand is stitched a little better than most, the center magnets are not as strong as other brands we've purchased. I constantly need to close the bottom manually because the magnets aren't powerful enough. I have had $9.99 brands that snapped shut far better.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa F.

customer_reviews.title: This is good for airflow
customer_reviews.text: I like it, it will not fit all door sizes, so make sure you measure your doorway before ordering. My dogs are still getting used to it since they do not have a doggy door. I put it on the basement door since there are no windows. The material seems sturdy, although I am not sure it will last for several years. I would consider buying it for other doors. The holes are big enough that a good number of bugs can still get it. It does not stop gnats, mosquitoes, or other small-ish bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Cook

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: This is our second magnetic screen. The first lasted about 2 weeks before it was torn and unusable. This one had a tear in it within the first 12 hours. Now, it ripping at the bottom seam. It’s been up for almost 6 days.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Works well, check your size twice and get the exact size though.
customer_reviews.text: • Magnets work well, closes nicely. • Velcro supplied works better than anticipated. • Tape on the back of Velcro adheres well to door trim. - Size is for stated maximum size, not up to that size. I have extra both vertically and horizontally which I had to fold in order for the door to function properly. - Directions would have you attempt to stick the Velcro tape to your door trim with the screen door attached to the Velcro. I chose to to apply the tape to the house door frame and then attach the door to the Velcro as this method seemed less cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Agee

customer_reviews.title: Read all the reviews.
customer_reviews.text: This one looked like the one on the house we just purchased. Since the one that was already intalled when we purchased looked old, I thought to replace it. Big mistake. After one day it started to fall apart. A magnet fell apart and it rips very easy. Very disappointed and should have listened to the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Effective, easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: We use it on our deck door to allow our dog (not bugs) to go in and out as needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good build, but Screen doesn’t fully shut after opening
customer_reviews.text: I just installed my 36” width screen and I’m a bit dissatisfied with how the screen Doesn’t fully snap back together once I open it... The screen fails to snap back together beyond midway down. I thought maybe I had the wrong with by I ordered a 36” width screen for my 36” threshold! I would greatly appreciate hearing back from the product maker to see how I can resolve the screen not sealing entirely in the middle after opening.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM SKINNER

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty bummed that I couldn’t install a solid screen at my new apartment, but am surprisingly pleased with the appearance, durability, and ease of use of this screen. It really does look nice, closes easily every time, and does allow my cats to go in and out freely. Will be purchasing a second for my back door. The weights at the bottom are a must for my breezy area. My only issue was that the installation instructions are a bit vague on exactly where in the doorframe to attach it. I opted for a few inches outside my door because it fit best there due to its length, and allowed good space for my welcome sign.
customer_reviews.author: othentic

customer_reviews.title: So useful
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs who have separation anxiety. This did not withstand them and maybe it was my fault thinking it would. It was so amazing and nice to have up while it lasted! It went up easy and looked amazing. The magnetics made it where every time you walked through it closed. It was a nice dream being honest. A week in my dogs freaked out and destroyed it. The product was not ready for my dogs and if your dog just occasionally jump on the door this will withstand it, if they go berserk this will not work. This was a great product and if you have calm dogs or no dogs I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Joe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: This. Is the best. Thing. EVAR! So I've got a door that leads to my porch and I couldn't EVER have that opened to allow the cool breeze to come in, as it would bring every insect known to man (Exaggerating but it was bad) into my home. With this installed I can freely open the door and be insect free. It's working so well that's the first thing I do every morning and that door just stays open ALL day and night till I call it quits. Amazing product, you will not be disappointed. NOTE: it was just SLIGHTLY short for my door frame so I stuck it along the EDGES of the door frame. And this worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: C Moon

customer_reviews.title: Nice Magnetic Screen Door
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this purchase was good. NOT GREAT but a good one. It is functional. Nice Black color. Super easy to install. Will be super easy to take down and clean. And not having to use your hands to open the screen outlet is nice especially when having a laundry basket in-hand. Nice. Did I say price was right? It was a good affordable price. I wish the bottom opening would close completely with the magnets in the in-seam but most of the time we have to kneel down and hand-pull the two screen sides together to close.
customer_reviews.author: Redlands Educator

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but it was troublesome for my double door
customer_reviews.text: My neighbors have this exact item and it's great. However I have a double-width door that only opens on one side. What I didn't realize is that the casing between the two sides doesn't come out as far, so I had to install the screen sort of cock-eyed. Other than that, the only other issue (which isn't the fault of the product) is that if you have a metal door, the bottom of the screen will snap onto the door sometimes, so you have to pull it off now and then. Other than that, you will love this product! It's been great to keep the door open and keep most of the bugs out.
customer_reviews.author: P. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy, Super Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t try the adhesive because my door frame is textured so we used the thumb tacks it comes with. The thumb tacks work okay. They tend to come out from time to time, might want to nail it in place if you can’t use the adhesive. It works great otherwise. We have zero bugs that come in which is important because I have a ton of house plants and plus who likes flies? Snaps closed real quick also! A must buy. If you have pets they can get in and out easily. I had to teach my cat out to go in and out but it’s easy to get through for a 12lb cat.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: With the few extra dollars vs cheapy ones.....
customer_reviews.text: This is a much better quality product vs the $14.99 tv one. The fabric is a dense heavyweight strongly sewn border with a tough fiberglass netting and strong magnets than actually close fully on contact. I had to return mine only because of size and wished I could have used it. It comes with a full roll of Velcro,not cut pieces and inches tacks as well. Also the top seam where the two panels meets are sewn with reinforced fabric for extra durability. Very well made and should work as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Beachman

customer_reviews.title: It really does work.
customer_reviews.text: If you follow the installation instructions the screen door works perfectly each time. We have a small problem that is not the manufacturer's fault. We bought two screens. Both of our doors are metal, the strong magnets in the material have a tendency to cling to the door, but that's only when the door is closed. So it's really not a problem, because when the door is open the screen returns to its closed position by itself. I can't verify durability yet; they've only been up for about 2 months. Nevertheless, for the price tag, the door seems to be a good product.
customer_reviews.author: I. Tremaine

customer_reviews.title: Works Great to keep bugs out
customer_reviews.text: I can't say much about installation since parents put it up before I got home, but it goes a long way to say Chinese parents are able to put this up without my help or being able to read the instructions. It works great to enter and exit the balcony without letting bugs in. Magnets snap back into place quickly so you don't have to fidget around trying to close it. Auto-close is probably best and most practical functionality since you don't have to slide it open and close like a sliding screen door. it allows for good air flow. No cons so far. Haven't experienced dust or weather yet so will update in the future.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps 'too' durable
customer_reviews.text: One of the keystone features of this product is the durability and 'extra' stitch reinforcement. The reason I knocked a star off is because the stitching where the two sides meet, at the top, is a little too restrictive. This leads to a less 'fluid' time passing through the screen. Overall not a huge issue, but if you are not careful it would be easy to get caught and either drop what you are carrying or potentially pull the entire thing down if you have enough force. Overall a good product, but where you feel tension when going through it is a little awkward.
customer_reviews.author: A Helpful Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for dogs or kids
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because I wanted to allow my dogs to enter and exit my screened porch while avoiding trapping birds in the porch. I was not particularly optimistic, however, this product actually works very well. My dogs determined very quickly that they could enter and exit the porch at their leisure. At the same time, we have not accidentally trapped a single bird since this product was installed. It has remained attached to an exterior door frame all summer without peeling or in detachment. I would definitely order another one of these for next summer if this one does not last through the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: A must have for backdoors
customer_reviews.text: There is a ridiculous number of insects in our subdivision (all the neighbors have complained to our HOA), so we were desperate for something we could use besides installing a screen door. We needed to be able to leave our backdoor open so our kids could play in the backyard safely, but the swarm of insects would invade our home. This is our second magnetic screen, but the reason we had to replace it was not the product's fault but our dog and 4 year old's doing. I would replace this 1000x if need be because it is SO helpful, easy to install and durable (except against excitable canines and mischievous little boys).
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Ehh. Some screws required.
customer_reviews.text: I am mostly happy with this product. My only complaint is the adhesive. While the first application of the screen door stuck well it moves it will never stick again. I found that as you pass through tugging will happen and the sticky will fail. ALSO getting the angle just right at the center point is critical to the screen closing. If you don't create a peak in the center the magnets will not catch every time. I ended up using some small wide head screws to gets this to stay in place. The adhesive no loner works so there are small gaps in places. But over all it does what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Great for little kids
customer_reviews.text: I installed this magnetic door on my screened-in porch because my youngest child would always push on the screen in the regular door and I was worried that it would become damaged. The doorway is aluminum so I wasn't sure if the adhesive would last. I made sure to clean and dry the surface first. Installation was easy and it's holding strong even with high humidity and storms. It does blow open with a strong breeze but it closes itself quickly. Now my kids can run in and out easily but the bugs do not easily come in. It's also nice that I don't have to wrestle a door when my hands are full of food for the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Great product, holds up well
customer_reviews.text: Very nice net, just wish it came in white to match my houses exterior. I recently received over 30 people for a backyard BBQ, the net and adhesive held up well with the constant in and out traffic. Dog was scared to go through at first but now manages just fine. Overall this is an excellent net, it auto closes most of the time with little need to manually align the magnets. Adhesive is strong and it's easy to install. I will have to see if it holds up for multiple seasons, but my expectation is that this will be a yearly or once every two years purchase given the high traffic that door gets.
customer_reviews.author: V. Silva

customer_reviews.title: Works Exactly As Described. Exactly.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect to like this thing. I didn't expect it to actually do what it claimed, despite the positive reviews. Replaced a 15-year old aluminum 1/2 screen half panel door on our screened porch; installation was a breeze...after velcro-ing the tape to the proper edges, gently tap the supplied tacks to hold the screen as you adjust/ fit it around the exterior door frame, then peel the backing off the tape in 6-8-inch sections, sticking down to the exterior frame as you go, removing the necessary tacks as you progress. In the end, I only left 3-tacks along the top Freakin' works like a charm. How long it will last is the only remaining question.
customer_reviews.author: T.L.B.

customer_reviews.title: Best I have used so far.
customer_reviews.text: This product is better than a similar and more highly promoted item. It has more magnets in the closure and full velcro strips on the sides. It seems to be made of a more durable material as well. It is important to follow directions for hanging, though. If the center of the top strip is allowed to sag, it will not close properly, and if you allow the bottom to drag on the ground you will have problems at times closing the door because the weighted strips will sometimes blow across the threshold and jam the door. Just follow the directions and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Don Handy

customer_reviews.title: Follow instructions, and - and your house can be free of bugs & mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.text: I just installed the mesh door, and it works exactly as the directions suggested. I'm VERY happy with the purchase, and my little dog is adjusting to it quickly!
customer_reviews.author: juli

customer_reviews.title: So far, works very well
customer_reviews.text: Our back door has a roof line that blocks an outward opening screen door, so this is a very good solution. I quickly attached it to the door frame, and used the enclosed tacks to reinforce at the corners, the opening at the middle, and a few along the top part of the sides. I don't think it's going anywhere. We have a metal door, which isn't recommended, but it's not really a problem. This closes well pretty much all of the time, and my wife loves it. It really helps keep the insects out.
customer_reviews.author: Marty d'FriedTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Great screen, love them
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love that we can leave the door open with these screens. I only expect them to last one season, and that's okay. The only flaw is that there were not nearly enough push pins to attach to a wood door frame. I have bought the Magic Screens before and they have twice the amount of pins. I went to my local big box store and bought some furniture nails to put them on, but after having to buy the nails, it would have been almost more worth it to buy the name brand. Yes, I would buy again, but they need more pins with the package.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great substitute for sliding screen door.
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to install. Using these at my back patio sliding doors. My screens had holes in them and didn't slide well. Decided to use this instead of fixing my screen doors. They stay closed and are easy to walk thru. Really like them. I've only had them for 1 summer so we will see what happens next summer. Because the screens are velco to the tape that is mounted around my door frame I am going to take these down for the winter and store them inside. We will see how the mounting tape holds up to New England winter.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Segal

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 2+ years
customer_reviews.text: Writing this in May 2020 having bought this in March 2017. I thought to write this because we're finally replacing it. This is much better than other mesh magnetic screens we've had. It closes very nicely down the whole length where others only close in a few spots with some gaps open. It went strong for about 2 years before becoming brittle by sun exposure and starting to rip in a few places. We picked up another brand that I just installed, but I'm likely going to order this one again as the other brand doesn't close as easily.
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for dogs and flies!
customer_reviews.text: We have a busy household of more then a few mastiffs along with living in the country. Flies are just a thing to deal with, but since we started using this screen on the side yard door and back yard the dogs have been able to go outside and not bring their little fly friends back in with them! We live by the river so we are able to leave the doors open in the evening to allow the breeze from the delta in! Because the frequency of usage we do replace them at least twice a year-but it’s cosmetic little tears at the bottom from the dogs hitting it over and over but nothing you couldn’t live with
customer_reviews.author: Harding House

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to install. Magnets close quietly.
customer_reviews.text: This was so much easier and less expensive that replacing my slider screen. It was easy to put up. I only rated 4 stars because my dogs collar caught on the bottom of one panel and tore the trim seam and pulled the whole screen away from the door. I just used Gorrila tape to hold it back together. Otherwise my 4yr old and 1yr old can go in and out to play and I don't get a million bugs. My parents got the As Seen on TV version and the magnets are in plastic boxes outside the screen. This screen is nice that the magnets are sewn in and close quietly. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works like a snap.
customer_reviews.text: SWEEET. Works great to keep insects out of the house. You can walk right through it without using hands and it closes with a snap behind you. Just take your time in gtting it up and adjusted correctly before sticking the tape to the wall. Be sure to have the top center a little above the edges and not have the screen pulled too tightly before sticking the tape down. Sorry I didn't buy this some time ago. A friend of mine has a slightly different one from another manufacturer (sorry, don't know the name) but it does not snap together nearly as well as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Charles F. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 dogs. 2 big and 1 small so this would have helped tremendously in the spring/fall. I’m short so I had my husband install it. Seemed very simple. The dogs figured it out quickly. My issue presented itself the second day it was up. I noticed it has a tear in the seam which makes the screen pointless. I had to take it down and will stick to keeping the big door closed for now. Great concept. Just quality issues. I’m thinking it could have been a shipping/packaging problem vs manufacturing based on everyone else’s reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Jgramm

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a spring-return screen door that was increasingly hard to use - it was between the den and my wood shop and the slot in the bottom was always getting clogged with sawdust. This one works just like the video shows. The only caveat I have is that it sometimes gets stuck on the metal door itself (door frame is wood). I made a little modification - cut the two "flaps" at the top edge so I can pull them from the hook & loop strip, then fold them each back out of the way when hauling stuff through the doorway. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysBusy

customer_reviews.title: the paper on the tape should not be pulled to quickly
customer_reviews.text: Great we used at the garage door at the side of the house for cross ventaltion. Of course there is very little traffic at that door. Also this is late spring for us in AZ so I do not know how it will stand up to the heat. But then again I cannot imagine leaving the door open in summer either. I did place a 4 inch cross bar across the bottom as we have scorpions and lots of lizards so I did not want them sneaking in when we were not looking. But so far would recommend to anyone with a low traffic door.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Gma in AZ.

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping mosquitoes out!
customer_reviews.text: We love this screen! Keeps the bugs out and closes automatically behind the kids. Not the most durable and it is developing small holes by the opening but for the price, I’ll buy one every year! Update: Homitt sent us a new screen when we contacted them about the holes developing after a couple of months - I've already purchased one for our front door as well. This doesn't look as sharp as a storm door but we plan to keep it on for the summer months because nothing works as well as this for keeping out bugs!
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the weight on the bottom. Never had a problem with it staying and closing. Can't use the Velcro again now that we've moved into a different house. It is durable and love the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Betty K

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I like this product very much as it was an inexpensive way to allow my dogs access to the backyard without having to cut a hole in the door. I did find out that when they run through it the magnets will stick to the metal door sometimes and I intend to install a nonmetallic kick plate to help with this. Also, my dogs have already snagged the bottom of the mesh and created a small hole which is not a big deal but I would like to see maybe a little more reinforcement on the bottom of the screen. All this said, I think it is an excellent alternative for the money.
customer_reviews.author: BLRGFTN

customer_reviews.title: Great product and it works
customer_reviews.text: I like that for once I bought something that works as advertised. The directions are accurate when it says to raise the middle slightly for it to close properly. I used the tacks as the Velcro kept coming off at the edges but no big deal. I thought that was to be expected with my 100 GSD running back and forth. It took him about 1/2 a second to figure it out. He loves it and we had a very nice day today. Cool and breezy.
customer_reviews.author: celteyes

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents who were hesitant at first for me to install it. But, once installed it was a big hit. They love to keep their front door open during the day and there was always a huge problem with flies coming into the house. And, when they were preparing food, it got even worse. After installation, the change was immediately noticeable. Now they enjoy their open door and no longer have to fight flies. Also their two small dogs have had no problem coming and going with the screen in place. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: salsateresa

customer_reviews.title: Mesh is substantial
customer_reviews.text: This is fairly heavy duty mesh and the magnets keeping the "door" shut are many and powerful. Easy to install. I wanted this for a large balcony sliding door; however the mesh is designed to attach to three sides of a regular-size door frame. So, I only have attached my new doggy screen door to two sides of frame (one side and the top) because it is a very wide frame and I can't attach to the sliding door, yet it is still working fine. It is pretty sturdy. And if installed properly, the magnets attract and the door closes nicely after Fido enters/exits.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reader

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but works
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect with this product, having been looking for an affordable screen for our back door for awhile. We received it and applied to the outer frame of our back door yesterday as one of our neighbors was going to his apartment and the screen certainly served as a good barrier for the current social distancing since neither of us were masked. I was concerned someone might accidentally pull the screen down since it adheres with stick tape along sides and top. But the tacks that come with screen seem to secure it. Does this same company have a garden version to protect our lettuce from neighborhood cats?
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Using this for the doorway to my green-house, it's working great!
customer_reviews.text: I needed more ventilation in my green-house, but I was worried about bugs and critters getting in. I put this up on the inside of the greenhouse, stapled up one side completely around the border (top and bottom) because adhesive didn't work. This keeps one side from opening and rigid, but I was afraid critters would just slip in through the bottom. The other side is only stapled on the top and side with the bottom being free to move. It worked out way better than I expected!
customer_reviews.author: Julian Sisko

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: The material really is nice and sturdy. I've had it up only a few wks and i'm happy with it. I have it stuck on the outside of the house, which is stucco. The adhesive on the velcro is regular, so I used some nails (large staples actually) to help. I wouldn't be surprised if it starts coming off in a few months with the cooler weather though, so I'll prolly purchase industrial strength velcro strips. I left the bottom couple feet unattached - lets my furbaby through easier. And the magnet strength with the thick fabric is perfect - strong enough to come together quietly and effortless to push through.
customer_reviews.author: A. DeGuzman

customer_reviews.title: Well made, holds together well.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased an inferior product several years ago & wasn't impressed with it. When we decided to try again, I checked on Amazon & decided to purchase this screen as it was an Amazon choice & had good reviews. We are very pleased with the quality & how well it performs, even with our 4 large dogs. The only real draw back is when it gets windy it blows the screen open, but for the most part we also close the door when it's windy. Time will tell how well it holds up, but so far we are pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: Mine only lasted a little over a year
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great product but within a year it started falling apart. I first noticed these long strange gray pieces on the ground outside the door and eventually realized it was the magnets falling out of the middle section. The rubber or vinyl is cracking and allowing the magnets to fall out and with less magnets in place it starts closing less reliably. I'm off to buy another brand to see if it lasts longer. I like having a magnetic screen door but this one should have lasted more than a year in my opinion. It's installed on a back garage door, and does get direct sunlight in the evenings.
customer_reviews.author: D. McEntire

customer_reviews.title: Very neat but a tip for installation
customer_reviews.text: Very nice design but need to think and measure carefully before installation 1. leave few inches loosen when nail it on the frame or wall, since the breeze will make the magnetic closing impossible to kiss each other 2. they provided enough nails in the package and you may not need to use the sticker stripe. Because that sticky thing is impossible to take off if you wanna adjust the curtain position... I learned my lesson by peeling it off and then able to say hi to my drywall....
customer_reviews.author: TBuzz

customer_reviews.title: Great Screen door!
customer_reviews.text: Great screen door with quality feel! Installation was pretty easy, (just make sure you read all of the instructions and tips beforehand!) I was finished with the whole process in under 10 minutes. If you anticipate frequent use, I'd also recommend using the included pins to hold it in place in addition to the velcro. Together, they hold the screen in place really well, nice and sturdy! Now that it's installed, I really love how easy it is to go in and out, it closes behind me on its own! It lets a nice breeze in without blowing out of place or letting bugs in.
customer_reviews.author: Bolingbroke

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Our old one (different brand) finally wore out after two moves and we realized we couldn't got without it. We go outside a lot and especially with a three year old- the backdoor is always being opened and not always immediately closed. Great for keep bugs out and instantly closes behind you, so don't have to worry about my son (or husband) leaving door open and letting anything in. The fact that you can cut this to fit your exact door is perfect- I bought one that was too large and this eliminated purchasing another one that I couldn't use.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Roff

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money on Magnetic Screen Door - Dog approved.
customer_reviews.text: As fall approaches, we have our doors open more often now using the new screen door. We've been using for a couple of weeks now. My two dogs(20 and 40 lbs) love having access without having to bother us to let them in or out. The run in and out, full speed, and haven't torn or damaged the screen. Nor has the velcro come apart. The dogs started using it immediately with no training needed. I guess because they can see through it. Considering all the activity, there are very few bugs getting into the house. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Papagiglio

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Pleased
customer_reviews.text: When this product first came on the scene from "As Seen On TV" the quality was junk. The magnets didn't hold and the strength of the adhesive wasn't great. I visited my sis last year and saw that she had one that was working fantastic for her dogs. So, I bought this brand and it hasn't failed me yet. Great adhesive and the magnets are strong. it closes every time. It worked for a 225 lb Mastiff. It became our dog door from our pool screen to the yard. We just removed a 3 foot area of our screen panel and hung this at the top and of the cage and it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: tbear

customer_reviews.title: It actually works great , not a cheapo piece of junk at all .
customer_reviews.text: This magnetic screen works Great ! I admit I was skeptical that it might be a piece of crap but it Not! It fits Exactly in my door frame - the adhesive velcro that they furnish you is the exact correct amount and it stays i’m place after application. The screen fabric itself is quite string and durable and the magnets are strong and actually hold it closed even in strong wind. I thought it was going to be a cheapo piece of junk but instead , i’m actually impressed and I really like it - it does work exactly perfectly and it takes maybe all of (4) minutes to install .
customer_reviews.author: slickwings

customer_reviews.title: Not dog friendly! Poor craftsmanship!
customer_reviews.text: This screen is nice. Installation went smoothly. I bought it based on the illusion that it was dog friendly. And yes, it was dog friendly at first, but my dogs eventually just tore it off when they saw a squirrel in the back yard. The first time I just rehung it back up. The second time the single stitching ripped apart and the magnets fell out. Poor quality craftsmanship!
customer_reviews.author: mac80mn1543

customer_reviews.title: The sizing is for a huge door frame
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is meant for a door with a huge door frame. Not a normal-sized one in a condo/apt. It says for 35-37" doors, get a 39" screen. We have a 35" door and it was SO big we could not stick it onto anything. So we have to return. Our frame is like 37.5" not sure if we should get 36 or 38. So irritated!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Margaret

customer_reviews.title: DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this for a year and a half now and it’s held up extremely well against two adults, two active kids, and a dog going in and out several times a day. My youngest pulled her wagon through it, it’s been yanked on, loads of groceries pushed through, and it’s like new. We purchased this because we live on a farm and the flies are bad, this thing has been a life saver. They come in when we open the actual door, but don’t get passed this thing which makes me so freaking happy.
customer_reviews.author: MMM

customer_reviews.title: ... Door by Homitt from Amazon and I am totally pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my second Magnetic Screen Door by Homitt from Amazon and I am totally pleased with it. The magnets hold it closed securely once you have entered or exited through it. We actually tore the first one moving large furniture through our front door without removing the screen first. We live in the country and have a lot of flies to deal with and this screen door does it's job very well. I would recommend this screen door to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Skip Haines

customer_reviews.title: It did what it was supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I got this so my dogs could go in and out and my cat would stay in and the bugs would stay out. Unfortunately my cat figured it out first, so that didn’t help. It seemed to keep the bugs out. After 2 months it had a hole from my dogs scratching and after 4 months the adhesive started to fall off and after winter it barely stayed on at all (we removed the screen for winter but left the adhesive velcro on). So it’s a seasonal product if you have pets and/or you may have to buy some new velcro after one year. Other than that it did it’s job and it was a cheap option.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Lucid

customer_reviews.title: Stays put and closes like it is supposed to. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: It was a little hard to put up and make sure it would hang where the ends would be just a bit below the door (we got one for our sliding porch doors). After we got it up it works great! The dogs can go right out and it pops back closed as well as when we go out of it! I have 2 dogs a medium-size mixed breed and a big rottweiler and they both use it many times a day and it has held up to that treatment already for a few months with no rips, tears, or without falling down. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn

customer_reviews.title: holds up really well
customer_reviews.text: We bought this so we could keep the backdoor open for the dogs without worrying about the plethora of flies that we usually get in exchange. It has held up extremely well. There are a few holes at the bottom thanks to the dogs stepping on it or scratching on it (from the rare occasion we have had to keep them outside for a bit), but that has never ripped the adhesive or velcro off. We did need to readjust the velcro at one point to help the screen magnets close properly once more, but other than that, there have been no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Reyn

customer_reviews.title: Can be used with double door with DIY Faux Beam
customer_reviews.text: This product works as promised! I had not realized when I ordered it that the door I wanted to screen should've actually called for a double door sized screen. This door only opens on one side from the leftmost part of the frame and I thought was a window on the other side. Not wanting to return and repurchase, I rigged a faux center beam in the middle of my door (see attached photos - the top photo in the collage attached has a blue line indicating where the actual frame is and a green line showing where I installed the faux beam)
customer_reviews.author: Ana Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Works great and has been a blessing!
customer_reviews.text: I love in a house with no central air so its crucial i have a breeze coming through at almost all times. I couldnt install a screen door as im renting so this was the next best option! And i gotta say i love it, magnets hold great, we get 50mph winds frequently near my house and its never split open but yet my little yorkie is able to push her way in and put of the door which is an amazing plus! Just saying if this is on your list of solutions for no screen door, its worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Sage

customer_reviews.title: Really high quality. Seals great.
customer_reviews.text: It REALLY WORKS. We're on vacation directly on the beach, but the patio door has no screen. We tried leaving the door open to enjoy the Florida breezes, but the gnats started pouring in. I ordered the magnetic screen door, and 2 days later we had a screen. I only used about half the tape and velcro to install it...so I'll be able to easily take it down in 2 weeks when we check out. I installed it on the inside of the aluminum patio door rather than the hot exterior, so it's very stable. Overall, everything about it is very high quality, sturdy, and solid.
customer_reviews.author: Nevis Rik

customer_reviews.title: Fails to meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: I have two similarly constructed doors for keeping out heat/cold and they are fantastic, so thought this "screen" would meet the same standards of construction. Not so !!!! The panels fail to meet at magnets, leaving me with an open area for bugs to fly right into the house. I believe the width is the issue, there's just not enough leeway for the magnets to connect. Live and learn, I will continue my search as I need a screen for the cats.
customer_reviews.author: JudiAnne

customer_reviews.title: Problems with the adhesive
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy and fast. It took my husband about 5 to 10 mins to install. We have a 6 month old pup that was able to use the screen without any difficulty and magnetically closed with ease with him going in and out. After the first 2 weeks the adhesive pulled away from one side and pulled the paint off the door frame. without any additional adhesive to replace with we took the screen down taking yet more paint off the frame. The only other problem area we had was if anyone pulled the screen too far apart it would stick to the metal door while open preventing the screen to close completely at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Steele

customer_reviews.title: Damaging, not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: The wind will knock this thing around like crazy because the magnets are so weak. The adhesive works well until it doesn’t and when it comes off, if you’ve put it over a painted door frame, the paint comes off with it. Our apartment complex has made people stop using them and pay for the damage they cause.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Alderman

customer_reviews.title: Helps Us enjoy the fresh air
customer_reviews.text: We have had this on our door for awhile. It has held up quite nicely. I wanted security screen doors to let air in while we sleep but we have French style doors and a security screen door is pricey for this style. But we also needed something for the day, mostly I was looking for something to keep out basic bugs like mosquitos. This works so well. After passing through, you often have to make sure to unstick the magnets from the doors back to the center, otherwise those bugs will pass through the small opening at the base that didn't close up on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Julielle

customer_reviews.title: Fits exactly and easy to install and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed product. See my Photos for installation tips. Installed on our interior door frame using push-pins on the top frame. Used the 3M Velcro tape on the side of the door frame along with additional push-pins through the Velcro tape. Then put the screen door on to hide the pushpins for a seamless install. Love the product. It fits our door frame exactly. Make sure you measure you door exterior frame prior to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: V. Pok

customer_reviews.title: A sticky mess
customer_reviews.text: Install was a little frustrating with the adhesive sticking to itself at times. This screen was great until my dogs went through and the sides ripped off. The magnets are strong to keep the screen shut and bugs out, which is great, but it doesn't work well with dogs. When my dogs went inside/outside, I would first have to separate the magnets and hold the screens apart because otherwise the adhesive would rip off of the doorframe.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! We recently moved to a new apartment. We had a metal screen door at our old apartment (that we bought when we first moved there but couldn't bring because our landlord thought it was theirs 🙄). There’s a nice breeze since we live in an upstairs corner apartment. I always wanted to keep the front door open but hated when bugs would come in. I’m so glad we got this. It’s thin enough that you can feel the breeze coming in but thick enough that no bugs will. Our downstairs neighbor was impressed so I ordered one for her too! They are also happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well and easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Works great for when the door is open, essentially waiting for one dog to come in while the other is still wandering. Seems to keep bugs out. The dogs are figuring it out, one plows through the other barks at it first. It's been up for a few weeks with no signs of falling down. The installation was quick and simple. Clean where you want to attach it. Stick the velcro together and stick it up. I am looking forward to leaving the door open when the weather cools.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Bones

customer_reviews.title: Works to create a doggie door
customer_reviews.text: I am using this screen to keep the bugs out when my French patio doors are open. I had to modify the way it is hung but it is holding up after several months and it is working. I saved a lot of money by not converting my French doors to a slider. I can open the door and the dog runs out. Instead of having to close the door all the way to keep in the air conditioning I close it just so it is cracked enough for the dog to nose her way back in. I don't have to leap up and run and close the door as I know the bugs aren't getting in.
customer_reviews.author: Judith M. Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Works and is easy to size and install!
customer_reviews.text: Installation easy; appears to work well. Just need to be careful it doesn’t “stick” to metal door with magnets. Very good price for purpose in this back door location.
customer_reviews.author: Rance R. Wall

customer_reviews.title: Life changer. Love it
customer_reviews.text: Read the full directions. Place a little higher in the middle top so it closes easier. Absolutely love this. Going to buy another for our back door. One of the best purchases I’ve made on here. Our cat uses it fine and dog does too! Coming in they want help (Our door has about an inch or so rise so it’s more of a push in and can get stuck) but they’ll go out just fine. Seriously if you’re considering it get it. We haven’t turned on the AC this summer yet because we have windows open and now the front door and it’s been amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: This is the best of the best!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these types of magnetic screens for years. My dogs like to run in and out but I try to keep the bugs out and these work perfectly. However, this is the best one I have ever had. It's more durable, and the way the magnets hooked together is so much better! This one is the best of the best!
customer_reviews.author: Kris Bitar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have dogs that love to go in and out and in and out and this is the perfect solution! I’m able to leave my back door open without bugs getting in the house. The only issue I have is that when the dogs run through, the magnet on the screen swings back and sometimes sticks to my metal door and I have to go over and pull it off so it stays closed. I also made the mistake of closing my door one time and one of my dogs scratched at the screen to come in and made a small hole, but I patched it up.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria McClure

customer_reviews.title: Magnets came out somehow
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had this for about two months now and can give a good description of how well it holds up. The magnets from the bottom had already started falling out within weeks. It is a little annoying to unhook the magnets in the middle when trying to reach the doorknob to unlock my door but it’s doable. It’s also pretty see-through and you can see right into my home. Other than those issues, it’s nice to have a screen that protects from bugs entering.
customer_reviews.author: Linda N.

customer_reviews.title: I love it !
customer_reviews.text: Got it today and immediately put it up. Feels heavy...good quality. I didn’t use the Velcro but instead the pins as I’m renting an apartment. I love how it fit. The only thing I would say is that if your not using the Velcro you’ll have to pull hard and flatten the sides to avoid gaps between pins. Also after I put it up I realize the bottom had a gap.. oh well but either way it works as I wanted. IMy dog (jack-chi) still hasn’t learn how to go in nor out and has been going crazy barking inside😄.
customer_reviews.author: Estherb

customer_reviews.title: Not enough velcro product if you mess up or want to move it
customer_reviews.text: I like it but there isnt enough of the adhesive strip. I had put it originally on a door, and noticed it needed to go a bit higher because it wasnt closing properly at the bottom. The adhesion will not come off at all, so I can't move the already placed velcro strip but I have no extra to use to move it up higher. So now it's too long and doesn't work properly because I don't have enough product to move the item to a better spot.
customer_reviews.author: Me92

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought to put over the front door when I needed to take it down for a couple days to repaint. However I really liked it and I haven't even painted the front door yet. Will have to wait until the weather cools down now as it's been in the l00's here lately. Very easy to install. Only took a few minutes. So far our older dog hasn't tried to push through it to get into the courtyard. Pushes apart very easily and always goes back together. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to standard screen door.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a bit challenging only because our door frame is non standard. I was able to remedy. Word of caution is to make sure you follow the instruction to mount the center higher than the 2 ends. I say about 1 inch higher. This gives the screen material some slack so the magnets can meet on the upper part. Its does not explain it very well on the enclosed instructions. Other than that, it works for our backdoor and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: theresa mathews

customer_reviews.title: Easier and less permanent than a doggy door
customer_reviews.text: We did not have a screen door or a doggy door for our dogs and this looked like an easy solution for both. Just installed and I'll update the review once I've used it for a while. I adhered it to the metal outside of our door although the instructions said not to stick it to metal. We don't get much sun so I hope it sticks. I put the velcrow on the door and then stuck it to the door so I didn't have to worry about measuring. My dogs figured out how to use their noses to walk through the door almost immediately. Much easier than installing a doggy door.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: I’m impressed
customer_reviews.text: The durability of the product is yet to be determined, but we go through several “magic mesh” screen doors per season, as we have a doggo that uses it constantly. The design of this one is so unlike any other I’ve seen. Magnets are reinforced, actually in the fabric of the screen, and rather than a few Velcro strips, this one has a continuous Velcro strip around the entire frame of the screen. I installed without even using the pins, and it seems great so far. I would definitely recommend this over the cheaper versions of “magic mesh”- especially if there’s high traffic through the doorway. Very impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

product_meta.title: Homitt Magnetic Screen Door with Heavy Duty Mesh Curtain and Full Frame Hook&Loop, Hands Free, Pet and Kid Friendly, 39” x 83”, Black
product_meta.description:
Size Name:39"*83"

Homitt Magnetic Screen Door keeps bugs off, let fresh air in and easy for toddlers & pets to walk through freely, it makes your life more comfortable and easier! 

Silent and Better Sealing
The design is based on no noise, door screens with magnets and magnetic seals, they can close door more quickly, quieter and closer. It is much better than plastic snaps, because magnet screen doors can avoid noise when you through the screen door.

Never blown up by Wind
Also, there are four sets built-in gravity stick in screen doors for homes, so the mesh curtain have enough heavy to make screen door hang straightly, and it can close the door more quickly after walking through; do not need to worry about wind will be blew your screen door.

Make Your Life Easier
The magnetic screen doors sewn hook&loop on screen doors, they are different from old styles that use tacks to fasten the screen door. It is more convenient and easier to remove in winter when you do not use it. 

Specification
Magnetic screen door size: 39”*83”
Fits door size: 36” x 80”, 38” x 80”, 36” x 82”, 38” x 82”.

Note
1.Measure your door and door frame first, choose the size according to outer diameter. Don’t buy the one which is smaller than your door frame.
2.Please do not buy this if you have a metal door, the magnetic will stick to your door and won’t close.
3.Please make sure the center of the top mesh slightly higher than two sides. It is better to hang screen to the floor. Don’t let too much screen put on the floor, it will impact the effect of closing.
4.The mesh is used for single door only.
5.Please read instructions before installation, it will help you install magnetic screen doors correctly.
feature_bullets: Hands free, pet & Kid friendly, Homitt magnetic screen door provides you with a comfortable environment.

DOOR SIZE COMPATIBILITY UP TO 37"X82":The SIZE OF THIS MAGNET SCREEN DOOR is 39”x 83”, and it fits door size to 35” x 81”, 36” x 82”, 37” x 81”, 37” x 82 ". The mesh use high-density material, strong and durable. Let fresh air in and make pesky flying objects not enter the house. NOTE: Measure your door firstly.

MAKE LIFE EASIER- HANDS FREE & UNIQUE WIND PROTECTION DESIGN: 26 pcs sewed in strong magnetic points make the screen door mesh curtain close much quicker and more silent. Unlike others, our screen curtain added 8 pcs gravity sticks at the bottom to make sure the screen curtain do not being blown open by wind.

DURABLE & DETACHABLE: The unique reinforcement line design protects the top of screen snap door from tearing for longer life. Homitt magnetic screen door use full frame hook&loop which paste more firmly than small strips and you can remove the mesh curtain anytime.

KIDS & PETS FRIENDLY: Homitt screen door is made from durable polyester fabric which can withstand thousands of going through. And it is lightweight enough for children and small pets to go inside and outside of the house freely. The magnets seal the gap together quickly, so you don't need to help your pets to close the door.

EASY TO INSTALL IN FEW MINUTES: No tools are required. Package includes: Screen door, a roll of hook&loop, and a pack of push pins. Clean door frame surface firstly to ensure long lasting. Then attach the screen mesh to the door frame with the nylon sticker. And push pins to secure the screen into its place much more stable.

specifications.Material: Only "Homitt Direct" is the authorized legal representative of Homitt products, please don't order from other seller
specifications.Usage: Keep Bugs Out, Let pets go though it freely!
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars9,360 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
